results.title: Berth 24
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: Describes the ‘turn-round’ of a ship - S.S. Bravo - which plies with freight and passengers between Hull and Gothenburg. For an army of men, from river pilot to Stevedore, each ‘turn-round’ is a test of professional skill, and a race against time if tides are to be caught and schedules kept. The film tells the story of what this means to George Moore, a foreman docker, and to a Swedish passenger who comes to England as a buyer of British goods.

results.title: Bert Newton's IMT [Live from HMAS Cerberus]
results.creator_credit: Bill Beams, Terry Gill and National Nine Network
results.brief_description: A record of the IMT live broadcast from HMAS Cerburus during Navy Week in 1970 which includes commercials. Bert Newton is joined by Lucky Star; Gaynor Bunning; Tim Evans; Johnny Walker; Alison Durban; Judy Scott; Bettina and Bryce; Miss Teen America and Patti McGrath. Commercials include: Yalumba Brandivino; Mastercut butchers; Victa mowers (Pete Smith); National vacuum cleaners; Yates lawn seeds; Remy Martin Brandy; Benson & Hedges cigarettes (Stuart Wagstaff); Capitol bread; SPC canned fruit; Ponds face cream; Ponds busy girl instant shampoo; State Savings Bank; Kraft ‘quick n easy’ dried peas (Bruce Mansfield); Cedel anti-perspirent; Monash cigarettes; Gold Medallion homes; Lipton tea bags.

results.title: Bernstein on Beethoven: a tribute
results.creator_credit: Humphrey Burton, Amberson Productions and CBS
results.brief_description: Leonard Bernstein traces the life of Beethoven and plays sections from the “Piano Concerto No.1 in C Major” in a musical celebration of Beethoven’s Bicentennary at the Vienna Festival of Music. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students.

results.title: Berlin: outpost of freedom
results.brief_description: West Berlin is an outpost of freedom in the Russian dominated sector of East Germany, encroached on all sides by Soviet armed strength. Reporting factually on the current Berlin crisis, reviews the main events since World War II which have lead to the present situation. Thousands of refugees have fled from East to West Berlin in a desperate bid to escape the tyranny of the Communist regime. The threat by Russia to change the status of Berlin has become a problem of world proportions. No other credits available.

results.title: Benny Hill: Bennies from heaven
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Carter and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a compilation of excerpts from the British television program “The Benny Hill Show” during the period 1964-1967. British comedian Benny Hill died in 1992 but is still remembered for his rather wicked schoolboy sense of humour, the sometimes tasteless sexual innuendos and smuttiness in his comedy skits and sketches and the wonderful send-ups from TV game shows and news broadcasts, to film parodies, the Royal family and top Hollywood stars. Included in the cast of many, is Australian singer and entertainer, Patsy Ann Noble. Written by Benny Hill with additional material by Robert Gould. NOTE: Due to the archival nature of this material, the sound and picture quality may vary occasionally.

results.title: Beni Abbes: science in the desert
results.brief_description: Beni Abbes is a Scientific Research Centre, set up in the Sahara by the French. This film shows some of he work being done, in an effort to make the desert fertile once more. Test growing of plants, the use of wind to drive pumps which draw water from below the sand, and an experimental station which aims to harness the sun’s heat to produce power are some of the activities shown.

results.title: Beneficient reprobate: ethyl alcohol, its nature and properties
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton and Burton Holmes Films
results.brief_description: Sponsored by the Women’s Christian Temperance Union, this film deals with the industrial uses of alcohol, and the effects of alcohol on the central nervous system of the human body. Produced from Bertha Rachel Palmer’s “A Syllabus in Alcohol Education”.

results.title: Benedictus
results.brief_description: A mood film which attempts to convey the passage of human life. Simple still nature photography is used to illustrate the theme, with the camera focussing and de-focussing on the subject. A lyrical flute accompaniment gives emphasis to this quiet unassuming film. No other credits available.

results.title: Beneath the dream
results.creator_credit: Peter Pastorelle, Nihon Hoso Kyokai and UNICEF
results.brief_description: Fuku and Lee are two young Chinese women helping underprivileged youngsters on the island of Hong Kong. One teaches the island’s many working children at a part-time school. The other runs a mobile library (supplied by UNICEF) bringing books, a chance for recreation and learning, to children living along the shores in sampans.

results.title: Bending lead pipes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plumbing”.
The process of bending a lead pipe subjects it to certain stresses and strains. Shows the procedure to correct the difference in pipe wall thickness that occurs.
